page.title: 14CHILDREN'S CLUBS
page.content: The favourite club is the Youth club, where you can play pool, badminton and other games. It costs between 15 and 30 pence. The next favourite club is Guides. Again they meet once a week and the charge is about 20 pence. Here girls learn to tie knots and study to pass badges. They also play games. Scouts is also quite popular. Scouts learn to canoe, cave and climb.They go camping every week in the summer. Each village has its own football club, and that club is in the league and they can enter the cup each season. Then there is horse riding. It costs from 2 to 5 pounds a lesson. There are many clubs in this district. We have Cricket, Karate, Cubs, Gym, BMX, Rugby and Netball clubs.
